drug.name: Fenretinide
drug.description: A synthetic retinoid that is used orally as a chemopreventive against prostate cancer and in women at risk of developing contralateral breast cancer. It is also effective as an antineoplastic agent.

article.citation: Formelli F, Cavadini E, Luksch R, Garaventa A, Villani MG, Appierto V, Persiani S: Pharmacokinetics of oral fenretinide in neuroblastoma patients: indications for optimal dose and dosing schedule also with respect to the active metabolite 4-oxo-fenretinide. Cancer Chemother Pharmacol. 2008 Sep;62(4):655-65. Epub 2007 Dec 8.

Takahashi N, Watanabe Y, Maitani Y, Yamauchi T, Higashiyama K, Ohba T: p-Dodecylaminophenol derived from the synthetic retinoid, fenretinide: antitumor efficacy in vitro and in vivo against human prostate cancer and mechanism of action. Int J Cancer. 2008 Feb 1;122(3):689-98.
Simeone AM, Tari AM: How retinoids regulate breast cancer cell proliferation and apoptosis. Cell Mol Life Sci. 2004 Jun;61(12):1475-84.

drug.indication: Investigated for use/treatment in macular degeneration.
drug.mechanism-of-action: Fenretinide inhibits the growth of several human cancer cell lines, acting through both retinoid-receptor-dependent and retinoid-receptor-independent mechanisms.1In vivo, fenretinide selectively accumulates in breast tissue and is particularly active in inhibiting rat mammary carcinogenesis.1 An important feature of fenretinide is its ability to inhibit cell growth through the induction of apoptosis rather than through differentiation, an effect that is strikingly different from that of vitamin A.1 In contrast to tamoxifen, which inhibits only estrogen receptor (ER)-positive tumors, fenretinide induces apoptosis in both ER-positive and ER-negative breast cancer cell lines.2 All of these properties render fenretinide an attractive candidate for breast cancer chemoprevention.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as retinoids. These are oxygenated derivatives of 3,7-dimethyl-1-(2,6,6-trimethylcyclohex-1-enyl)nona-1,3,5,7-tetraene and derivatives thereof.

category.category: Compounds used in a research, industrial, or household setting

drug-interaction.name: Darbepoetin alfa
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Darbepoetin alfa is combined with Fenretinide.

Berman HM, Westbrook J, Feng Z, Gilliland G, Bhat TN, Weissig H, Shindyalov IN, Bourne PE: The Protein Data Bank. Nucleic Acids Res. 2000 Jan 1;28(1):235-42.

polypeptide.name: Retinol-binding protein 4
polypeptide.specific-function: Delivers retinol from the liver stores to the peripheral tissues. In plasma, the RBP-retinol complex interacts with transthyretin, this prevents its loss by filtration through the kidney glomeruli.

go-classifier.description: embryonic retina morphogenesis in camera-type eye
negative regulation of cardiac muscle cell proliferation
